SENT.plain: Second malignancies are uncommon events in the survivors of allogeneic transplant procedures, although they are increased compared to normal control populations
Among these malignancies, sarcomas are exceedingly rare
In addition, relapse of primary myelodysplasia rarely occurs after 5 years from the time of allogeneic transplantation
This report describes an unusual presentation of liposarcoma with concomitant relapse of underlying myelodysplasia developing in a patient 9 years after the first of two allogeneic transplantations
